info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 4:47PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cook County through 515 PM CDT... At 447 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Humboldt Park, or over Austin, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chicago, Evanston, Skokie, Oak Park, West Town, West Ridge, Austin, Lincoln Park, Lake View, Irving Park, Chicago Loop, Melrose Park, Maywood, Norridge, Navy Pier, Belmont Cragin, Dunning, Edgewater, Rogers Park and Near North Side. Including the following interstates... I-90 between mile markers 81 and 84. I-94 between mile markers 41 and 51. I-290 between mile markers 20 and 22. I-294 between mile markers 41 and 51. This includes... Lincoln Park Zoo, Loyola University, Triton College, Northeastern Illinois University, Wrigley Field, and The Loop. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
